content.intro: As a cross-border merchant intelligent collaboration platform service provider, we focus on providing small and medium-sized cross-border e-commerce merchants with a full-chain solution of 'data integration + automation'. We deeply understand the extreme importance and legal responsibility of protecting customer data and personal information (including enterprise users who use our services and their end customers). This privacy protection statement aims to explain to you in a transparent and detailed manner how we collect, use, store, protect, share, and delete your information in accordance with international best practices, applicable laws and regulations (including but not limited to the General Data Protection Regulation GDPR, China's Cybersecurity Law, Personal Information Protection Law, etc.) and specific platform policies (especially the data protection policy DPP and acceptable use policy AUP of e-commerce platforms), to ensure that your data assets and privacy rights are respected and protected to the highest standards.
content.applicability: This statement applies to all systems, cloud services, API interfaces, and related support services provided by our company that you access and use.

section1.title: 1. Types and Scope of Information We Collect
section1.content: To ensure the normal operation, continuous optimization, and provision of excellent user experience of cross-border collaboration services, we strictly follow the principle of 'data minimization' and only collect information that is directly related and necessary to achieve the stated purposes. This information may include:

accountInfo.title: Account and Identity Information:
accountInfo.content: When you register, create a user account, or renew services, we will collect your enterprise legal person name, unified social credit code, registered address, main contact person's name, position, email address, phone number, account login credentials (encrypted storage), and financial payment-related information.

businessData.title: Business Operations Data:
businessData.content: Core business data that you upload, generate, process, or store through our cross-border collaboration platform. These data are your daily operational digital assets. Including but not limited to:
businessData.orders: Order and Sales Data: Customer order details (product name, quantity, price, status), sales records, transaction history, return information, etc.
businessData.procurement: Procurement and Supply Chain Data: Supplier information, purchase orders, warehousing records, logistics documents, etc.
businessData.inventory: Inventory and Warehousing Data: Product SKUs, inventory levels, warehouse locations, batch information, inbound/outbound operation records, inventory counting data, etc.
businessData.products: Product and Product Data: Product descriptions, attributes, categories, image URLs, prices, Listing status, etc.
businessData.financial: Financial and Accounting Data: Sales revenue, costs, profits, invoice information, aging analysis, etc. (usually aggregated or non-directly identifiable financial indicators).
businessData.hr: Employee Management Data (if the collaboration platform includes HR modules): Basic employee information, attendance, compensation, etc.

pii.title: End Customer Personal Identification Information (PII) Processing:
pii.content: If your business scenarios involve processing personal information of your end customers (for example, when our cross-border collaboration platform pulls order data through e-commerce platform API integration, it will include buyer names, shipping addresses, contact phone numbers, email addresses, and other sensitive information), these PII will be protected and restricted at the highest level, strictly complying with data protection policies.

technical.title: Service Usage and Technical Data:
technical.content: Data about how you and your users access, configure, and use our cross-border collaboration platform. Including but not limited to: your IP address, device identifiers, operating system type, browser type and version, access time, page views, feature usage frequency, error logs, diagnostic information, API call records, etc. This data is mainly used for service operations, troubleshooting, performance monitoring, security auditing, and compliance verification.

support.title: Technical Support and Communication Information:
support.content: When you interact with our technical support team or customer service team, you provide relevant problem descriptions, system logs, screenshots, phone recordings (with your consent), and other diagnostic data.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.content: We strictly follow the principle of 'clear purpose, reasonable necessity' and only use the collected information for the following specified purposes, and commit not to use it for other purposes inconsistent with the stated purposes:

service.title: Provide, maintain, and optimize cross-border collaboration services:
service.content: This is the core purpose of our information collection. Including but not limited to account setup, service activation and management, system function implementation, data storage, transaction processing, customer support, system maintenance, version upgrades, and continuous improvement of service performance.

personalization.title: Personalize and enhance user experience:
personalization.content: Based on your usage preferences and patterns of collaboration platform features, optimize interface layout, recommend related features or services, and improve operational convenience and efficiency.

analytics.title: Data integration, analysis, and insights:
analytics.content: Integrate, deeply process, and analyze your business data to generate multi-dimensional reports, provide business insights, predictions (such as sales forecasting, inventory turnover forecasting), and decision support assistance, thereby helping you improve operational efficiency and market competitiveness.

security.title: Ensure service security and compliance:
security.content: We use information to perform strict security verification, monitor suspicious activities, prevent fraud, identify and respond to security incidents, ensure stable system operation, execute our service agreements, and strictly comply with all applicable laws and regulations and policy requirements of cooperative platforms such as e-commerce platforms (such as e-commerce platform AUP and DPP).

legal.title: Fulfill legal obligations and regulatory requirements:
legal.content: Comply with court orders, legitimate requests from government agencies, or other legally mandatory obligations.

communication.title: Communication and notifications:
communication.content: Send you updates, technical alerts, security notifications, service changes, maintenance plans, renewal reminders, and other important information related to cross-border collaboration services.

piiUsage.title: Specific purpose PII processing (special note):
piiUsage.content: For end customer PII that we obtain from e-commerce platforms (such as e-commerce platforms), we implement the strictest usage restrictions:
piiUsage.fulfillment: Order Fulfillment Support: PII data (such as buyer names, addresses, phone numbers) will be strictly processed within our internal cross-border collaboration platform for accurate order records, internal order verification, comprehensive order tracking functionality, and seamless integration with our internal processes (such as shipping document generation, warehouse management). This is crucial for ensuring order data integrity, promoting internal operational efficiency, and providing sellers with a complete sales view.
piiUsage.customerService: Customer Service Support: When assisting you in handling end customer inquiries or resolving order-related issues, relevant PII may be used under strict control.
piiUsage.commitment: We solemnly commit that such PII will never be used for marketing, advertising, data analysis (unrelated to fulfillment and customer service), or any other purposes unrelated to order fulfillment and customer service.

section3.title: 3. How We Store and Protect Your Information
section3.content: Our company regards data security as the lifeline of the enterprise and commits to adopting industry-leading, multi-layered, comprehensive technical and organizational measures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of your data throughout its entire lifecycle:

encryption.title: Secure Data Architecture and Encryption Technology:
encryption.transit: Transit Encryption: All data transmitted through public networks, including PII and business operations data, are protected by industry-standard encryption protocols (such as TLS 1.2+) and HTTPS for end-to-end encryption.
encryption.atRest: At-Rest Encryption: All sensitive data stored on our servers, databases, and backups (including PII and critical business data) are encrypted using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES-256). Encryption keys are strictly managed and stored separately from data.
encryption.environment: Secure Storage Environment: Data is stored in high-security cloud service environments with international information security certifications (such as ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II), equipped with strong physical security controls, network security protection (including WAF, DDoS protection), and environmental controls.

accessControl.title: Strict Access Control and Identity Authentication:
accessControl.principle: Principle of Least Privilege: All employee and service account access permissions are strictly limited to the minimum necessary to complete their responsibilities.
accessControl.rbac: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): Apply fine-grained permission management to different employees and system functions.
accessControl.mfa: Mandatory Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA): All internal employees and external partners must enable MFA when accessing sensitive systems or data.
accessControl.identity: Unique Identity Identification and Password Policy: Mandatory use of unique user IDs and implementation of complex password policies (e.g., at least 12 characters, including uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols, with mandatory periodic changes).
accessControl.audit: Access Logging and Auditing: Detailed recording of all data access, modification, and operation logs, with continuous monitoring and regular auditing to ensure traceability and timely detection of abnormal behavior.

isolation.title: Data Isolation and Redundancy:
isolation.customer: Customer Data Isolation: We take strict technical and logical isolation measures to ensure that different customers' data do not affect each other at the underlying storage and application levels, preventing data cross-contamination.
isolation.backup: Data Backup and Disaster Recovery: Regular automated encrypted backups of all critical data, securely stored in geographically dispersed cold storage services. We develop and regularly exercise disaster recovery plans (DRP) to ensure that in extreme cases, we can quickly restore the availability and access capabilities of PII and critical business data (meeting RTO/RPO objectives).

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability Management and Security Testing:
vulnerability.scanning: Regular Vulnerability Scanning: Conduct comprehensive vulnerability scanning at least every six months, covering all systems and applications.
vulnerability.penetration: Annual Penetration Testing: At least annually hire independent third-party security agencies to conduct penetration testing, simulating real attacks to discover potential vulnerabilities.
vulnerability.code: Code Security Review: Conduct strict code security review and testing before each new code/feature release to prevent introducing new security defects.

incident.title: Security Incident Response and Management:
incident.irp: Comprehensive Incident Response Plan (IRP): Develop and maintain comprehensive security incident emergency response plans, clearly defining incident types, response procedures, responsible persons, escalation paths, and communication mechanisms.
incident.evidence: Incident Recording and Evidence Chain: Detailed recording of all security incidents, remedial measures taken, and corrective measures, and maintenance of evidence chains for all related evidence.
incident.notification: Timely Notification: Once any data security incident occurs (such as data breach or unauthorized access), we will immediately initiate emergency response procedures and report within 24 hours in accordance with applicable laws and regulations and cooperative platform requirements (especially e-commerce platforms, notification to sp-api-security@amazon.com), minimizing the impact on users.

section3.training: Employee Security Awareness Training: Regular mandatory training on data security and privacy protection for all employees (including new employees) to ensure they understand and comply with all security policies and operating procedures.

section4.title: 4. How We Share Your Information
section4.content: We strictly follow the principle of 'restricted sharing' and only share your information in the following strictly limited circumstances, and under the premise of ensuring data security and privacy:

providers.title: Service Providers:
providers.content: We may share your necessary information with third-party service providers who provide us with infrastructure, technical support, storage, customer service, auditing, and other necessary services. These service providers have undergone strict background checks and signed strict data processing agreements (DPA) and confidentiality agreements, committing to comply with data protection standards equal to or higher than ours, and can only use information for the purposes required to provide services to us.

legal.title: Legal Requirements and Regulatory Compliance:
legal.content: We may disclose your information when legally required, by court order, legitimate requests from regulatory agencies, or to cooperate with legal proceedings, execute our service agreements, protect the rights, property, and safety of our company or others.

business.title: Business Transfer:
business.content: In the event of merger, acquisition, asset sale, reorganization, bankruptcy, or other circumstances involving the transfer of our company's business, your information may be transferred as part of the business assets. In such cases, we will ensure that the recipient complies with the data protection standards specified in this privacy protection statement.

partners.title: Partners (Limited to Non-PII):
partners.content: We may share aggregated, anonymized, or de-identified non-personal information with business partners for market analysis, industry reports, service optimization, or new product development purposes. In such sharing, we never involve any PII that can be used to directly or indirectly identify you or your end customers.

piiSharing.title: Special PII Sharing Restrictions (Important):
piiSharing.content: We do not share personal identification information (PII) obtained from e-commerce platforms (such as e-commerce platforms) with any external parties. We commit that all PII obtained from e-commerce platform SP-API will be strictly limited to processing within our internal cross-border collaboration platform and will not flow to external third parties for order fulfillment (unless we obtain explicit authorization from e-commerce platforms in the future and sign strict DPP with third parties).
piiSharing.logistics: If our services include logistics tracking functionality, we may share non-PII order information (such as order ID, tracking number, and carrier name) with selected third-party logistics tracking service providers through secure encrypted channels, and only for providing you with real-time shipment status updates. All such data sharing strictly follows the principle of least privilege and complies with applicable data protection laws and regulations.

section5.title: 5. Personal Identification Information (PII) Retention and Deletion Policy
section5.content: We strictly follow the principle of data retention minimization and only retain your information for the time necessary to achieve specific purposes, fulfill legal obligations, or resolve disputes.

endCustomer.title: End Customer PII (such as buyer information obtained from e-commerce platforms):
endCustomer.content: The collection and retention of such PII is only for your internal order management and record-keeping purposes in the cross-border collaboration platform. According to relevant e-commerce platform (such as e-commerce platform) data protection policies, and to ensure your business compliance, such PII data will typically be securely deleted within 30 days after order shipment and successful delivery. Deletion methods include data erasure, physical destruction, or irreversible anonymization processing, ensuring that data cannot be recovered or reconstructed.

legalRetention.title: Legally Mandatory Retention:
legalRetention.content: If longer retention periods are mandatory due to applicable laws and regulations, regulatory requirements, or court orders, we will retain PII for the specified time. In such cases, PII will be encrypted and stored in secure and compliant cold storage services, and will only be accessed and used within the scope permitted by law, and will be immediately deleted after the legal period expires.

otherData.title: Other Business Operations Data (Non-PII) and Account Information:
otherData.content: The retention period for this data will be executed according to business needs, legal and regulatory requirements, tax obligations, and agreements with your service agreements. When data is no longer needed, we will securely delete or anonymize it.

deletion.title: Your Data Deletion Request:
deletion.content: If you submit a data deletion request according to Section 6 of this statement, we will respond within the time specified by applicable laws and ensure that all data is securely and thoroughly deleted from our active systems and backups.

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
section6.content: We fully respect your control over your own information. According to applicable laws and regulations, you have the following rights regarding your information:

rights.access: Right to Information and Access: You have the right to understand how we process your information and to access some or all of the personal information you provide to us.
rights.correction: Right to Correction: When your information is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request correction.
rights.deletion: Right to Deletion (Right to be Forgotten): In certain circumstances, such as when information is no longer necessary for the purpose of collection, or when you withdraw consent, you have the right to request us to delete your information.
rights.restriction: Right to Restrict Processing: Under certain specific conditions, such as when information accuracy is questionable or processing legality is disputed, you have the right to request us to restrict the processing of your information.
rights.portability: Right to Data Portability: Where technically feasible, you have the right to obtain information you provide to us in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, and the right to transmit this information to other data controllers.
rights.objection: Right to Object: You have the right to object to our processing of your information for specific purposes (such as direct marketing).
rights.withdrawal: Right to Withdraw Consent: If our processing of your information is based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time, but this does not affect the legality of processing before withdrawal.
rights.complaint: Right to Complain: You have the right to file a complaint with relevant data protection regulatory agencies.

section6.contact: To exercise your rights or if you have any questions about your data processing, please contact us through the contact information provided at the end of this statement. We will respond to your request within the time specified by applicable laws and according to your identity verification status.

section7.title: 7. Third-Party Links and Services
section7.content: Our cross-border collaboration platform or website may contain links to third-party websites, applications, or services. Please note that this privacy protection statement only applies to services provided by our company and does not apply to these third-party websites or services. We strongly recommend that you carefully read and understand their privacy policies before clicking any third-party links or using their services. We are not responsible for the privacy practices and content of any third-party websites or services.

section8.title: 8. Policy Changes
section8.content: We may update this privacy protection statement from time to time based on business development, technological advancement, changes in laws and regulations and regulatory requirements (including updates from cooperative platforms such as e-commerce platforms). Any updates will be published on this page with the effective date noted. We recommend that you regularly review this statement to understand the latest information. For any significant changes (such as fundamental changes involving data collection, use, or sharing methods), we will notify you via email or other appropriate means before the changes take effect and re-obtain your consent (if applicable).

section9.title: 9. Contact Us
section9.content: If you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this privacy protection statement, or wish to exercise your data rights, please contact us through the official website contact information. Thank you!
